intro: Uragoga portoricensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican uragoga, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow. It is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
